Sentencas: Ag-(0-8 mol%) CuO is used to successfully join aluminized ferritic stainless steel interconnect to the ceria-gadolinia (CGO) barrier layer of a solid oxide fuel/electrolysis cell by reactive air brazing at 1000 degrees C in air.
Titulo: Enhancing the long-term stability of Ag based seals for solid oxide fuel/electrolysis applications by simple interconnect aluminization

Sentencas: The wetting of Ag-CuO on CGO is tailored by varying the CuO content.
Titulo: Enhancing the long-term stability of Ag based seals for solid oxide fuel/electrolysis applications by simple interconnect aluminization

Sentencas: The effects of the CuO content on the joint microstructure are discussed.
Titulo: Enhancing the long-term stability of Ag based seals for solid oxide fuel/electrolysis applications by simple interconnect aluminization

Sentencas: The long-term stability of brazed joints is evaluated by aging in oxidizing (air) and reducing (4% H-2-50% H2O-N-2) atmospheres at 800 degrees C for 250 h. An Ag-2mol% CuO braze results in the best joint stability during aging.
Titulo: Enhancing the long-term stability of Ag based seals for solid oxide fuel/electrolysis applications by simple interconnect aluminization

Sentencas: Aluminization of the steel to create an alumina surface layer provides excellent protection of the steel both during the joining process and aging in the 2 atm.
Titulo: Enhancing the long-term stability of Ag based seals for solid oxide fuel/electrolysis applications by simple interconnect aluminization

Sentencas: No degradation related to steel corrosion and outward diffusion of elements from the steel can be observed.
Titulo: Enhancing the long-term stability of Ag based seals for solid oxide fuel/electrolysis applications by simple interconnect aluminization
